title: 112_hr429
content: Repeal of PPACA and health care-related provisions of HCERA. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (PPACA) and the health care-related provisions of the Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act (HCERA) are repealed, restoring the provisions of law as if the Acts had not been enacted. Extension of federal employee health insurance by amending Subpart G of title 5, United States Code to include a new chapter 89A for health insurance for non-federal employees. Definitions and provisions for this new chapter are outlined. The Office will administer a health insurance program for non-Federal employees under chapter 89A. Regulations will be prescribed to apply chapter 89 provisions to eligible individuals. Contracts will be made with carriers to offer health benefits plans to eligible individuals. Carriers may be required to enter into a contract as a condition of participation. Eligibility criteria for non-Federal employees will be established. Non-Federal employees can enroll in a health benefits plan under this section, except if they are already enrolled in a public health insurance program, a plan under chapter 89, or are a member of the uniformed services. "Non-Federal employees can enroll in a health benefits plan under this section, except if they are already enrolled in a public health insurance program, a plan under chapter 89, or are a member of the uniformed services. SEC. 8925. ALTERNATIVE CONDITIONS TO FEDERAL EMPLOYEE HEALTH BENEFITS PLANS." Rates and premiums for health benefits plans under this chapter may vary by geographic regions. No Government contribution is provided for individuals under this chapter. The Office ensures that individuals covered under this chapter are in a separate risk pool from those covered under chapter 89. Technical and Conforming Amendments include contract requirements for carriers to provide health benefits plans as described under chapter 89A. The table of chapters for part III of title 5, United States Code, is amended to redesignate chapters 89A and 89B as chapters 89B and 89C, respectively, and insert a new chapter 89 after chapter 89. SEC. 3. DEDUCTION FOR PREMIUMS PAID BY FEHBP NON-EMPLOYEE ENROLLEES. An amendment to the Internal Revenue Code allows for a deduction for premiums paid for FEHBP coverage by non-employee enrollees. In the case of an individual, a deduction is allowed for premiums paid during the taxable year for health insurance coverage for the taxpayer, spouse, and dependents under chapter 89A of title 5, United States Code. Coordination rules apply to prevent double deductions and the deduction is not allowed for self-employment tax purposes. The deduction allowed for health insurance premiums under chapter 89A of title 5, United States Code is not considered in determining an individual's net earnings from self-employment. Premiums paid for FEHBP coverage are deductible in computing adjusted gross income. A clerical amendment renumbers section 224 to 225 and adds a new item for section 224 in the table of sections. The Director of the Office of Personnel Management will submit a plan to Congress for the extension of the Federal Employee Health Benefits Program within 6 months of the Act's enactment. The plan will include the implementation of amendments and a schedule of actions to be taken.
